newsitem.title: NORWAY: SOCCER-ROSENBORG BEAT GOTHENBURG TO KEEP EUROPEAN HOPES ALIVE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROSENBORG BEAT GOTHENBURG TO KEEP EUROPEAN HOPES ALIVE.

text.p: Midfielder Bent Skammelsrud scored a penalty to lead Norway's Rosenborg to a 1-0 victory over IFK Gothenburg of Sweden on Wednesday and keep their hopes of a European Cup quarter-final place alive.
Rosenborg are third in Group D of the European Champions' League with six points, seven behind Porto and one behind AC Milan with one round of matches still to come.
Skammelsrud was the dominating player of a match played on a pitch kept green by under-soil heating while snow covered the surrounding field.
He fired the penalty past veteran Swedish international goalkeeper Thomas Ravelli in the 66th minute after Niclas Alexandersson was sent off for stopping handling the ball on the goal line.

It was Rosenborg's second Champions' League win over Gothenburg, following their 3-2 victory in Sweden in September and put paid to Gothenburg's chances of reaching the quarter-finals. Gothenburg's best chance came in the 73rd minute when Peter Eriksson had only Ravelli to beat but shot wide.
